byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and JONATHAN ANSFIELD
byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe reported from Hong Kong, and Jonathan Ansfield from Wenzhou, China. Michael Corkery contributed reporting from New York. Research was contributed by Kiki Zhao and Owen Guo from Wenzhou, and Yufan Huang and Zhang Tiantian from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Owners of Anbang, a Chinese insurer behind a wave of multibillion-dollar deals, include relatives and friends of its politically connected chairman.

headline.print_headline: Scrutiny on Its Ownership Trips Up a Chinese Giant
headline.main: A Chinese Mystery: Who Owns a Firm on a Global Shopping Spree?

snippet: Owners of Anbang, a Chinese insurer behind a wave of multibillion-dollar deals, include relatives and friends of its politically connected chairman....
abstract: Review by The New York Times of filings by corporate Chinese powerhouse Anbang Insurance Group reveals many of company's shareholders who live in rural Pingyang County in China are relative and acquaintances of company chairman Wu Xiaohui, who is in-law of former national leader Deng Xiaoping; American regulators have been examining Anbang's unlikely shareholders in light of company's surprising takeover spree, in which it has offers to pay over $30 billion for assets around globe.
